statements.text: Television is bad for people.
Television isn't bad for people.
TV is a vital outlet for the arts and creative human expression.
TV isn't a vital outlet for the arts and creative human expression.
TV might be the only exposure [1] to the arts for many people, assuming they do not read books or visit museums.
TV might be the only exposure [1] to the arts for many people, assuming they do read books or visit museums.
People should be incentivized to visit museums and read books, not find justification for their habit of watching poor quality TV programming.
People should be incentivized to visit museums and read books, find justification for their habit of watching poor quality TV programming.
The number of people reading books and visiting museums [2] around the world has been falling (p. 4 [3]).
The number of people reading books and visiting museums [2] around the world hasn't been falling (p. 4 [3]).
TV allows people to watch films they may have missed or would be unable to afford to see at the cinema.
TV doesn't allow people to watch films they may have missed or would be unable to afford to see at the cinema.
For people of a lower economic status, watching television is the only way they can enjoy the same movies as those who can afford to see them at the movie theater. Thus, TV is a social good.
For people of a lower economic status, not watching television is the only way they can enjoy the same movies as those who can afford to see them at the movie theater. Thus, TV is a social good.
The price of cinema tickets vary from country to country [4], and can be incredibly affordable [5] in some places.
The price of cinema tickets don't vary from country to country [4], and can be incredibly affordable [5] in some places.
Some movie theater chains give discounts for kids [6] and young people, senior citizens [7], members of the military [8], and essential workers [9].
Some movie theater chains don't give discounts for kids [6] and young people, senior citizens [7], members of the military [8], and essential workers [9].
In countries like Mali, a single cinema ticket can cost 59% of the average weekly wage [10].
In countries like Mali, a single cinema ticket can't cost 59% of the average weekly wage [10].
Theater promotions and cinema subscription services [11] can drive down the price of cinema tickets, making them even more affordable.
Theater promotions and cinema subscription services [11] can't drive down the price of cinema tickets, making them even more affordable.
Most films are only released to be shown on TV or streaming long after [12] they are released in cinema.
Most films aren't only released to be shown on TV or streaming long after [12] they are released in cinema.
Not everyone has the time to watch movies as soon as they hit theaters. Some might prefer the flexibility of watching the movie at a later date.
Not everyone doesn't have the time to watch movies as soon as they hit theaters. Some might prefer the flexibility of watching the movie at a later date.
New blockbuster movies are increasingly seeing early or simultaneous streaming releases [13].
New blockbuster movies aren't increasingly seeing early or simultaneous streaming releases [13].
The diverse offering of shows available on TV and streaming services [14] allows people to access a variety of content they wouldn't have access to otherwise.
The diverse offering of shows available on TV and streaming services [14] allowses people to access a variety of content they wouldhave access to otherwise.

Streaming services tend to have dynamic and restrictive catalogues. Netflix has around [15] 6,000 shows and movies, while IMDB is approaching five million [16] entries, meaning that only 0.12% of movies IMDB has indexed are available on Netflix.

Streaming services don't tend to have dynamic and restrictive catalogues. Netflix has around [15] 6,000 shows and movies, while IMDB is approaching five million [16] entries, meaning that only 0.12% of movies IMDB has indexed are available on Netflix.
Impoverished people who struggle to afford [17] cable television are left with just the local channels and few options for entertainment.
Impoverished people who struggle to afford [17] cable television aren't left with just the local channels and few options for entertainment.
Local channels are often biased and choose to present certain pieces of news while ignoring others.
Local channels aren't often biased and choose to present certain pieces of news while ignoring others.
Most people in the US trust local news more than national sources, and believe they are less ideologically biased [18].
Most people in the US trust local news more than national sources, and believe they aren't less ideologically biased [18].
Local news channels are more likely to encounter funding issues [19] than large national news outlets, and are thus more susceptible to bribery or economic biases.
Local news channels are more likely to encounter funding issues [19] than large national news outlets, and aren't thus more susceptible to bribery or economic biases.
People are watching less live TV [20] than ever before. With plummeting viewership, these channels may no longer exist in the future.
People are watching less live TV [20] than ever before. With plummeting viewership, these channels may longer exist in the future.
TV piracy [21] is accessible, on the rise and unlikely to lead to any severe consequences. If someone cannot afford TV, then they can easily pirate it.
TV piracy [21] is accessible, on the rise and unlikely to lead to any severe consequences. If someone can afford TV, then they can easily pirate it.
Many channels, especially those showing live sports, are illegally mirrored online [22] and available for free.
Many channels, especially those showing live sports, aren't illegally mirrored online [22] and available for free.
Pirate networks are frequently targeted and shut down [23] by international government investigations.
Pirate networks aren't frequently targeted and shut down [23] by international government investigations.
In poorer regions, one cable subscriber can share their access [24] with entire neighborhoods.
In poorer regions, one cable subscriber can't share their access [24] with entire neighborhoods.
Suggesting theft of intellectual property is hardly a reasonable substitute for paying for cable.
Suggesting theft of intellectual property isn't hardly a reasonable substitute for paying for cable.
People are only able to physically watch one TV channel at a time. While people without cable have fewer options, they are still able to access some form of programming.
People aren't only able to physically watch one TV channel at a time. While people without cable have fewer options, they are still able to access some form of programming.
The variety and diversity of channels available is the issue, not how many can be watched at once.
The variety and diversity of channels available is the issue, how many can be watched at once.
Many countries have national broadcasters, like the BBC [25], which can be accessed without an expensive cable subscription.
Many countries don't have national broadcasters, like the BBC [25], which can be accessed without an expensive cable subscription.
Picture-in-Picture [26] allows people to watch multiple channels at once.
Picture-in-Picture [26] doesn't allow people to watch multiple channels at once.
PiP, despite once being a popular feature, has been made obsolete [27] by newer technology.
PiP, despite once being a popular feature, hasn't been made obsolete [27] by newer technology.
There are 122 million homes [28] in the US with a TV. Having a means of consuming art in their home makes it far more accessible in general.
There aren't 122 million homes [28] in the US with a TV. Having a means of consuming art in their home makes it far more accessible in general.
TV requires that a household have consistent and cheap power, as TVs consume a lot of electricity [29].
TV doesn't require that a household have consistent and cheap power, as TVs consume a lot of electricity [29].
Many developing countries have load-shedding [30] or power outages [31], which might interrupt people's viewing to the point where the TV would be useless.
Many not developing countries have load-shedding [30] or power outages [31], which might interrupt people's viewing to the point where the TV would be useless.
TVs can be run using external generators [32], which are not reliant on national power grids.
TVs can be run using external generators [32], which are reliant on national power grids.
Most people cannot afford external generators—they are generally more expensive [33] to run than electricity from the power grid.
Most people can afford external generators—they are generally more expensive [33] to run than electricity from the power grid.
Electricity rates in some developing countries are capped, meaning they have less of an impact on the operational costs of owning a TV (p. 4 [34]).
Electricity rates in some not developing countries are capped, meaning they have less of an impact on the operational costs of owning a TV (p. 4 [34]).
Many people in the global south and developing nations worldwide have access to TV sets [35].
Many people in the global south and developing nations worldwide don't have access to TV sets [35].
Cable can be costly, especially in developing countries like the Philippines. Cable plans can cost US$35 [36] per month, yet the minimum wage is as low as US$7.50 per day [37].
Cable can't be costly, especially in developing countries like the Philippines. Cable plans can cost US$35 [36] per month, yet the minimum wage is as low as US$7.50 per day [37].
TV series can explore deep and significant philosophical and artistic themes.
TV series can't explore deep and significant philosophical and artistic themes.
The content of many TV shows is mindless [38], which is harmful to the viewer.
The content of many TV shows isn't mindless [38], which is harmful to the viewer.
Most TV shows are mindless and serve as an escape [39] from the problems and issues most people face on a daily basis.
Most TV shows aren't mindless and serve as an escape [39] from the problems and issues most people face on a daily basis.
Philosophical and artistic merit can be gleaned from nearly anything [40] one does in life.
Philosophical and artistic merit can't be gleaned from nearly anything [40] one does in life.
Viewers may want to relax by watching simple, entertaining programs which they do not need to intellectually engage with [41].
Viewers may want to relax by watching simple, entertaining programs which they do need to intellectually engage with [41].
Using one's brain is a natural and beneficial part of life; it can deteriorate [42] if not used regularly.
Using one's brain is a natural and beneficial part of life; it can deteriorate [42] if used regularly.
Characters in popular sitcoms [43] have been known to become stupider as the series progresses and the script quality deteriorates.
Characters in popular sitcoms [43] haven't been known to become stupider as the series progresses and the script quality deteriorates.
The majority of world's most popular TV shows [44] do not explore significant philosophical or artistic themes.
The majority of world's most popular TV shows [44] explore significant philosophical or artistic themes.
A number of TV channels [45] have intentionally dumbed down their content.
A number of TV channels [45] haven't intentionally dumbed down their content.

The critically-acclaimed TV anime, Neon Genesis Evangelion, explores themes of individuality, consciousness, freedom, choice, and responsibility [46]. Such heavy and complex themes are common in other art forms.

The critically-acclaimed TV anime, Neon Genesis Evangelion, doesn't explore themes of individuality, consciousness, freedom, choice, and responsibility [46]. Such heavy and complex themes are common in other art forms.
Black Mirror uses TV as a medium to critique technology and modern society [47]. This is a common theme in more traditional forms of art [48].
Black Mirror doesn't use TV as a medium to critique technology and modern society [47]. This is a common theme in more traditional forms of art [48].
Nearly one-third of UK adults [49] believe that TV programming gets worse every year.
Nearly one-third of UK adults [49] don't believe that TV programming gets worse every year.
Public perception does not equate to fact; people could become biased by others' opinions.
Public perception does equate to fact; people could become biased by others' opinions.
People might be exposed to poorer quality shows more often without the overall quality of shows decreasing.
People mightn't be exposed to poorer quality shows more often without the overall quality of shows decreasing.
TV is only an outlet for the creative expression of a small number of writers, directors, and producers. TV viewers are merely consumers.
TV isn't only an outlet for the creative expression of a small number of writers, directors, and producers. TV viewers are merely consumers.
Public-access TV [50] allows the average citizen to create and air their own creative works.
Public-access TV [50] doesn't allow the average citizen to create and air their own creative works.
The Writers' Guild of America (WGA) only has 20,000 members [51] and fewer than 5,000 [52] of them earned money from their screenplays in 2016.
The Writers' Guild of America (WGA) only doesn't have 20,000 members [51] and fewer than 5,000 [52] of them earned money from their screenplays in 2016.
Theater, school plays, and other live arts are also outlets [53] for creative expression.
Theater, school plays, and other live arts aren't also outlets [53] for creative expression.
Theater is more accessible than TV in terms of both participation and consumption.
Theater isn't more accessible than TV in terms of both participation and consumption.
Public theater, such as Shakespeare in the park [54], is often viewable free of charge.
Public theater, such as Shakespeare in the park [54], isn't often viewable free of charge.
Live arts are restrictive and unavailable most of the time. TV programming is always available, day and night.
Live arts aren't restrictive and unavailable most of the time. TV programming is always available, day and night.
Many adult entertainment centers are open most hours when many other plays and live arts performances are over.
Many adult entertainment centers aren't open most hours when many other plays and live arts performances are over.
TV has a negative impact on health.
TV doesn't have a negative impact on health.
Watching TV from the safety of one's home keeps people out of trouble and protects them from a variety of public dangers.
Watching TV from the safety of one's home doesn't keep people out of trouble and protects them from a variety of public dangers.
People can also involve themselves in potentially dangerous activities while watching TV, such as smoking marijuana [55].
People can't also involve themselves in potentially dangerous activities while watching TV, such as smoking marijuana [55].
Social isolation can cause loneliness, cognitive decline, and depression [56].
Social isolation can't cause loneliness, cognitive decline, and depression [56].
People who stayed at home watching TV during the pandemic kept themselves safe [57] and improved their relationships with their families.
People who stayed at home watching TV during the pandemic didn't keep themselves safe [57] and improved their relationships with their families.
Nearly four-in-five households [58] increased their TV consumption, which literally helped save lives [59].
Nearly four-in-five households [58] didn't increase their TV consumption, which literally helped save lives [59].
There was a marked rise in domestic violence [60] during the pandemic, indicating that many people, especially women, were not kept safe.
There was a marked rise in domestic violence [60] during the pandemic, indicating that many people, especially women, were kept safe.
People staying home could have been, and likely were, doing other activities [61] than watching TV.
People staying home couldn't have been, and likely were, doing other activities [61] than watching TV.
People can come together and form positive communities around their favorite television shows, improving mental health [62].
People can't come together and form positive communities around their favorite television shows, improving mental health [62].
The fan community around Star Trek has been described as good-willed and dizzyingly diverse [63], creating an undeniably positive environment.
The fan community around Star Trek hasn't been described as good-willed and dizzyingly diverse [63], creating an undeniably positive environment.
Even positive fan communities like Star Trek have an issue with extreme toxicity [64].
Even positive fan communities like Star Trek don't have an issue with extreme toxicity [64].
Some TV show communities can be toxic, engaging in bullying and other antisocial behavior [65].
Some TV show communities can't be toxic, engaging in bullying and other antisocial behavior [65].
Star Wars fan culture has been described as toxic [66], sexist, and closed-minded.
Star Wars fan culture hasn't been described as toxic [66], sexist, and closed-minded.
A man was beaten up in Hong Kong for spoiling the end [67] of Avengers: Endgame.
A man wasn't beaten up in Hong Kong for spoiling the end [67] of Avengers: Endgame.
The Doctor Who TV series has cultivated a large and loyal fanbase [68], which has lead to the development of multiple fan projects [69] and zines.
The Doctor Who TV series hasn't cultivated a large and loyal fanbase [68], which has lead to the development of multiple fan projects [69] and zines.

Shows like Game of Thrones [70] encouraged fan discussion and theory through their episodic nature, resulting in millions of fans flooding online communities with speculation about what would happen in the next episode.

Shows like Game of Thrones [70] didn't encourage fan discussion and theory through their episodic nature, resulting in millions of fans flooding online communities with speculation about what would happen in the next episode.
Even after the finale of the TV show, fan communities for the show and book series remain active [71] in multiple languages.
Even after the finale of the TV show, fan communities for the show and book series don't remain active [71] in multiple languages.
The obsession over Game of Thrones likely led to a decrease in productivity and social interaction as fans spent too much time [72] pouring over articles and expounding upon theories.
The obsession over Game of Thrones likely didn't lead to a decrease in productivity and social interaction as fans spent too much time [72] pouring over articles and expounding upon theories.
If people were to spend less time [73] watching TV, they would have more free time to pursue more constructive hobbies, or to play sports.
If people weren't to spend less time [73] watching TV, they would have more free time to pursue more constructive hobbies, or to play sports.
People could opt to instead engage with similarly unhealthy practices, such as playing video games or scrolling through social media on their phone.
People couldn't opt to instead engage with similarly unhealthy practices, such as playing video games or scrolling through social media on their phone.
TV causes physical health problems.
TV doesn't cause physical health problems.
Increased television viewing has a minor association [74] with shorter sleep duration.
Increased television viewing doesn't have a minor association [74] with shorter sleep duration.
A lack of sleep can increase the risk of high blood pressure, diabetes, and heart issues [75], demonstrating that increased TV viewing is bad for one's health.
A lack of sleep can't increase the risk of high blood pressure, diabetes, and heart issues [75], demonstrating that increased TV viewing is bad for one's health.
TV can encourage sedentary behavior [76], which can lead to health issues [77].
TV can't encourage sedentary behavior [76], which can lead to health issues [77].
Watching excessive amounts of TV can lower sperm count [78].
Watching excessive amounts of TV can't lower sperm count [78].
For men that do not desire [79] to have children, a lower sperm count is not a relevant concern.
For men that do desire [79] to have children, a lower sperm count is not a relevant concern.
Prolonged TV watching is associated [80] with higher colorectal cancer-specific mortality, independent of leisure-time physical activity, among colorectal cancer patients.
Prolonged TV watching isn't associated [80] with higher colorectal cancer-specific mortality, independent of leisure-time physical activity, among colorectal cancer patients.
There are a number of other activities and behaviors [81] which are equally or more likely to cause colorectal cancers.
There are a number of other activities and behaviors [81] which aren't equally or more likely to cause colorectal cancers.
People who watch more than two hours a day of TV have an increased risk of many diseases and reduced lifespan [82].
People who watch more than two hours a day of TV don't have an increased risk of many diseases and reduced lifespan [82].
Excessive hours of sitting to watch TV has been linked to an increased risk of dying from inflammatory diseases like Alzheimer’s and diabetes, according to an Australian study [83].
Excessive hours of sitting to watch TV hasn't been linked to an increased risk of dying from inflammatory diseases like Alzheimer’s and diabetes, according to an Australian study [83].
Reading is a sedentary activity, yet not labeled as a negative activity. As such, TV should be considered an adjacent category.
Reading is a sedentary activity, yet labeled as a negative activity. As such, TV should be considered an adjacent category.
Reading books has proven to have positive effects [84] on the development of children [85], brain function, and overall health, whereas watching TV has notable negative lifestyle effects [86].
Reading books hasn't proven to have positive effects [84] on the development of children [85], brain function, and overall health, whereas watching TV has notable negative lifestyle effects [86].
Reading has a number of associated physical and mental harms [87], similarly to watching TV.
Reading doesn't have a number of associated physical and mental harms [87], similarly to watching TV.
Sitting down for significant periods of time to watch television may increase the risk of dying from a pulmonary embolism [88].
Sitting down for significant periods of time to watch television may not increase the risk of dying from a pulmonary embolism [88].
TV viewers do not need to be seated while watching TV. They can perform exercises [89] or use exercise equipment, like a treadmill [90].
TV viewers do need to be seated while watching TV. They can perform exercises [89] or use exercise equipment, like a treadmill [90].
Very few people exercise while watching TV; Americans in particular spend significantly more time watching TV than exercising [91] in general.
Very few people exercise while watching TV; Americans in particular don't spend significantly more time watching TV than exercising [91] in general.
Couches and recliners, common seats used for watching television, are designed for unhealthy sedentary behaviors [92].
Couches and recliners, common seats used for watching television, aren't designed for unhealthy sedentary behaviors [92].
Watching excessive amounts of TV is likely correlated with health problems; in moderation, it presents no such harms.
Not Watching excessive amounts of TV is likely correlated with health problems; in moderation, it presents no such harms.
Health risks can occur after two hours [93] of watching TV. The average American watches more than five hours a day [94].
Health risks can't occur after two hours [93] of watching TV. The average American watches more than five hours a day [94].
In order for TV use to be deemed excessive [95], one must watch more than 3.5 hours of TV per day. It is likely that many people watch less than this.
In order for TV use to don't be deemed excessive [95], one must watch more than 3.5 hours of TV per day. It is likely that many people watch less than this.
Most TV programs are designed to encourage unhealthy watching habits.
Most TV programs aren't designed to encourage unhealthy watching habits.
TV streaming services encourage binge-watching by automatically playing [96] the next episode [97] of a series.
TV streaming services don't encourage binge-watching by automatically playing [96] the next episode [97] of a series.
Twenty-four-hour news channels compete for viewership by sensationalizing [98] news stories, which can end up causing anxiety and stress among viewers.
Twenty-four-hour news channels don't compete for viewership by sensationalizing [98] news stories, which can end up causing anxiety and stress among viewers.
Compared to other addictions, like cigarettes or alcohol, watching television is not as harmful.
Compared to other addictions, like cigarettes or alcohol, watching television is as harmful.
Television sets are built with harmful chemicals [99], the exposure to which could cause severe health problems.
Television sets aren't built with harmful chemicals [99], the exposure to which could cause severe health problems.
Smoking directly causes a number of ailments such as cancer, diabetes, heart disease, and bronchitis [100], as well as increasing the risk of a number of diseases.
Smoking directly doesn't cause a number of ailments such as cancer, diabetes, heart disease, and bronchitis [100], as well as increasing the risk of a number of diseases.
Abusing alcohol damages many internal organs, as well as increasing risk factors for heart attacks and stroke [101].
Not Abusing alcohol damages many internal organs, as well as increasing risk factors for heart attacks and stroke [101].
Prolonged TV watching increases the risk of diabetes and especially heart disease [102], which is more deadly [103] than all forms of cancer combined.
Prolonged TV watching doesn't increase the risk of diabetes and especially heart disease [102], which is more deadly [103] than all forms of cancer combined.
TV viewership is harmful to the physical and mental health of children.
TV viewership isn't harmful to the physical and mental health of children.
The physical health of children deteriorates when they watch excessive amounts of TV.
The physical health of children doesn't deteriorate when they watch excessive amounts of TV.
Kids who watch a lot of television may build less bone [104] during critical years and be more vulnerable to osteoporosis and bone breaks later in life as a result.
Kids who watch a lot of television may not build less bone [104] during critical years and be more vulnerable to osteoporosis and bone breaks later in life as a result.
A recent study [105] linked kids' TV habits with higher cholesterol and worse health outcomes, suggesting that two or more hours of daily viewing may produce heart problems later in life.
A recent study [105] linked kids' TV habits with higher cholesterol and worse health outcomes, not suggesting that two or more hours of daily viewing may produce heart problems later in life.
Parents are recommended [106] to limit their children to one to two hours of high-quality programming each day to protect them from negative influences or outcomes.
Parents aren't recommended [106] to limit their children to one to two hours of high-quality programming each day to protect them from negative influences or outcomes.
Children who spend many hours a day glued to the TV may be harming their ability to concentrate [107] and focus on tasks in school.
Children who spend many hours a day glued to the TV may not be harming their ability to concentrate [107] and focus on tasks in school.
Excessive hours spent watching television in a child's youth may be related [108] to an increased risk of antisocial [109] behaviour later in life.
Excessive hours spent watching television in a child's youth may not be related [108] to an increased risk of antisocial [109] behaviour later in life.
Diet and exercise [110] are the most important factors in raising healthy children; TV is not detrimental if children are active and eat well.
Diet and exercise [110] are the most important factors in raising healthy children; TV is detrimental if children are active and eat well.

A study [111] found that the more hours spent watching television, the more likely children were to be both fatter and less physically active. Notedly, kindergartners who watched more than three hours of TV per day were nearly 50% more likely [112] to be obese.

A study [111] found that the more hours spent watching television, the more likely children weren't to be both fatter and less physically active. Notedly, kindergartners who watched more than three hours of TV per day were nearly 50% more likely [112] to be obese.
TV lowers [113] the self-esteem of most children.
TV doesn't lower [113] the self-esteem of most children.
TV decreases the self-esteem [114] of white girls, Black girls, and Black boys.
TV doesn't decrease the self-esteem [114] of white girls, Black girls, and Black boys.
TV programs can foster and encourage good behaviour in children.
TV programs can't foster and encourage good behaviour in children.
TV can encourage [115] reading in children.
TV can't encourage [115] reading in children.
Shows like 'Reading Rainbow' [116] introduced children to books and stories they may otherwise miss.
Shows like 'Reading Rainbow' [116] didn't introduce children to books and stories they may otherwise miss.
Introducing children to the concept of reading books does not necessarily incentivize them to read on their own.
Introducing children to the concept of reading books does necessarily incentivize them to read on their own.
The British Council developed a list of eight common methods of encouraging children to read [117]; watching TV to incentivize the practice of reading was not mentioned.
The British Council developed a list of eight common methods of encouraging children to read [117]; watching TV to incentivize the practice of reading was mentioned.

Preschool children displayed less aggression and more empathy [118] towards others when their exposure to aggressive television shows were limited, and their exposure to educational programming was increased.

Preschool children displayed less aggression and more empathy [118] towards others when their exposure to aggressive television shows weren't limited, and their exposure to educational programming was increased.

When TV characters demonstrate social-emotional skills, children can learn from them. Television shows that depict sharing, getting along with others, or rejecting stereotypes can improve those skills in children [119].

When TV characters don't demonstrate social-emotional skills, children can learn from them. Television shows that depict sharing, getting along with others, or rejecting stereotypes can improve those skills in children [119].
The negative effects [120] of TV on children far outweigh the positive effects.
The negative effects [120] of TV on children far don't outweigh the positive effects.
Many activities are age-restricted [121] to protect the health of children; television is no different.
Many activities are age-restricted [121] to protect the health of children; television is different.
The TV rating system exists to prevent children from consuming inappropriate content on TV (p. 2 [122]).
The TV rating system doesn't exist to prevent children from consuming inappropriate content on TV (p. 2 [122]).
Broadcasters in some countries abide by a watershed [123], banning the airing of content deemed child-inappropriate before a certain time at night.
Broadcasters in some countries don't abide by a watershed [123], banning the airing of content deemed child-inappropriate before a certain time at night.
TV ratings systems have fundamental flaws [124] that prevent parents from making informed decisions on what their children watch.
TV ratings systems don't have fundamental flaws [124] that prevent parents from making informed decisions on what their children watch.
G-rated prime-time TV is nearly non-existent [125], and the lines between TV-PG and TV-14 categories are blurred [126].
G-rated prime-time TV isn't nearly non-existent [125], and the lines between TV-PG and TV-14 categories are blurred [126].
Shows rated TV-14 have as many depictions of smoking and drinking [127] as TV-MA programming, making it difficult for parents to prevent their children being exposed to this content.
Shows rated TV-14 haven't as many depictions of smoking and drinking [127] as TV-MA programming, making it difficult for parents to prevent their children being exposed to this content.
TV ratings systems are merely guidelines, and cannot be expected to replace the individual judgement of parents.
TV ratings systems are merely guidelines, and canbe expected to replace the individual judgement of parents.
It is the responsibility of parents to manage a child's TV usage and behaviour in order to limit any negative physical and mental effects.
It isn't the responsibility of parents to manage a child's TV usage and behaviour in order to limit any negative physical and mental effects.
TV has harmful psychological effects.
TV doesn't have harmful psychological effects.
Watching excessive [128] amounts of TV is primarily a form of escapism [129] from the pressures and stresses of daily life, suggesting that TV can actually be psychologically beneficial.
Watching excessive [128] amounts of TV isn't primarily a form of escapism [129] from the pressures and stresses of daily life, suggesting that TV can actually be psychologically beneficial.
Watching television relieves loneliness by providing the same sort of emotional support [130] as spending time with real people.
Watching television doesn't relieve loneliness by providing the same sort of emotional support [130] as spending time with real people.
Researchers [131] say that the social surrogacy provided by TV programs is a poor substitution for human-to-human experience.
Researchers [131] say that the social surrogacy provided by TV programs isn't a poor substitution for human-to-human experience.
TV promotes drug use and abuse.
TV doesn't promote drug use and abuse.

Movies & shows glorifying substance abuse lifestyle like Narcos [132], Breaking Bad [133] and The Wolf of Wall Street [134] are widely known, while there is little attention for the actual damages of the opioid crisis and the drug trade.

Movies & doesn't show glorifying substance abuse lifestyle like Narcos [132], Breaking Bad [133] and The Wolf of Wall Street [134] are widely known, while there is little attention for the actual damages of the opioid crisis and the drug trade.
TV has often been used to broadcast [135] the dangers of drug abuse, portraying [136] drug use in a negative light.
TV hasn't often been used to broadcast [135] the dangers of drug abuse, portraying [136] drug use in a negative light.
The causes of adolescent substance use are multifactorial, but the media can play a key role [137].
The causes of adolescent substance use aren't multifactorial, but the media can play a key role [137].
Portrayals of alcohol [138] in films and TV advertisements have an immediate effect on the amount of alcohol that people drink.
Portrayals of alcohol [138] in films and TV advertisements don't have an immediate effect on the amount of alcohol that people drink.
Television can create division with shows [139] that perpetuate false stereotypes.
Television can't create division with shows [139] that perpetuate false stereotypes.
Many TV shows perpetuate [140] the "angry African American" stereotype.
Many TV shows don't perpetuate [140] the "angry African American" stereotype.
Some shows can reinforce [141] the idea that masculine traits are more acceptable than feminine traits.
Some shows can't reinforce [141] the idea that masculine traits are more acceptable than feminine traits.

source_retrieval.text_raw: Vizio went so far as to retrofit old devices with spyware via a remote update, without getting their customer's consent [251].

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: Vizio [252] stated it used this capacity to best serve its customers.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: Samsung has issued a personal privacy statement, warning people not to discuss personal information around Smart TVs [253].

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: TV shows and movies often draw attention to complex social problems.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: "Guess who's coming to dinner? [254]" portrated inter-racial marriage at a time when such unions were controversial.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: Movies like Kramer vs. Kramer [255] and Mrs. Doubtfire [256] challenge traditional gender norms, giving audiences a new lens through which to see the world.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: TV is incredibly unrepresentative of real demographics and diversity [257], ultimately harming social movements.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: TV is responsible for eroding moral values in society.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: The American public believes that watching television erodes religious principles, honesty, and reliability [258].

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: Secular commentators also described controversial shows, such as Little Britain, as "offensive trash [259]" which featured blackface, and mocked women, the disabled, and homosexuals.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: Religious principles are no longer the means of measurement of social moral standards.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: Heavy television viewers, those who view for four hours or more per evening [260], are less committed to moral values like empathy and honesty.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: TV shows can be used to explore, teach, and strengthen moral philosophies [261].

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: Kids' TV shows are particularly adept at teaching moral lessons [262] to children.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: The moral lessons taught to children by TV shows may need additional reinforcement and explanation [263] from adults, suggesting that TV might not be the best medium for the transmission of these messages.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: TV shows and movies often pay homage to people who have made sacrifices for others. In doing so, they promote empathy, compassion, and altruism.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: TV shows and movies consistently misrepresent [264] people from history, doing them a disservice by promoting misinformation and occasionally, outright lies.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: Many movies are full of historical inaccuracies [265] which alter the course of history to fit the version told by the director and screenplay writers.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: Many of the stories told on TV and in movies are true stories that were nearly forgotten to history [266].

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: Books, newspapers, magazines, and print media in general are equally, or better, able to cover millions of amazing stories which were nearly lost to history.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: The scene at the end of The Titanic with the couple cuddling in bed as the water rises around them is based on the true story [267] of an old wealthy couple who gave up their lifeboat so that others might live.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: Some of the best war movies, such as Schindler's List, Hacksaw Ridge, and Dunkirk, are true stories. Many audiences learned some nearly-forgotten history [268] from these films.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: TV brings people together.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: Families often use TV as a means to come together and build up their relationships.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: Expanded screen size and enhanced TV technologies have helped bring families back together [269] in the living room, instead of being off in separate rooms.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: A group of people watching the same TV consume the same programming at the same time. This facilitates discussion and live reaction/interaction between each viewer.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: Unlike theater, people can pause or speak over the TV without interfering with the performance, facilitating discussion or commentary throughout the show or movie without taking away from the action.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: Sitting down together in front of the TV was regarded as the best way of catching up by more than half of families [270]. A further 12% claimed it was the only time they were ever together in one room.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: A group of people watching TV merely brings them together physically; without interacting with one another, there is no value added in simply being near someone else.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: Parents having physical contact with their children can bring them closer together [271].

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: TV can be used to influence [272] people with biased information [273] and prevent them from escaping from their information silos [274]. This worsens political polarisation.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: The act of watching TV makes people more passive [275] and accepting of authority.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: Subliminal messaging on TV is often used to sell products, which can often times be harmful, such as energy drinks and alcohol [276].

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: Subliminal messaging does not impact everyone [277] in the same way; most people are oblivious to it.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: Subliminal messaging [278] has been a part of Coca-Cola and many other corporations' advertising campaigns.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: More than 91 million viewers in Brazil, the equivalent of the audience for the Super Bowl, tune into just one channel [279] every night; the owner of the network can exert a significant amount of control over what those people see.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: Claims of media bias are generally overblown [280].

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: Watching a variety of channels, content, and news sources can help someone avoid getting stuck in an information bubble.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: The CIA has a history [281] of influencing public opinion through the media, for instance with Operation Mockingbird [282].

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: This is not a failure of TV, but rather a failure of people to apply critical thinking [283] to their media consumption.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: For some couples with busy personal and professional lives, watching TV is the only time they spend together.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: The biggest cause of fights [284] for couples is over who controls the remote; changing the channel even led a man to kill his wife [285].

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: Cuddling on the couch while watching TV is important for bonding and relationship building [286].

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: One quarter of couples are unable to agree on which show to watch and separate themselves to watch TV in different rooms [287].

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: Half of all couples [288] sit on the same couch and watch TV together.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: Couples who watch TV together have stronger relationships [289].

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: Violence on TV [290] is blamed for causing viewers to imitate violence and leads to an increase [291] in real-world violence and aggression.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: The widespread coverage of war, violence, murder, economic crisis, etc., on TV has negative effects on the collective consciousness [292].

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: As TV watching is so ubiquitous [293], finding a control group against which to test the causal link between TV and violence is quite difficult.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: Young people watch far less TV [294] compared to older people—they could be used as a control group in a study.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: Many countries require television users to pay a TV license fee [295]. Those who do not pay this fee could be established as a control group, as they likely do not have a television.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: Tens of thousands of people opt not to pay [296] for their license, yet continue to watch and consume TV.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: People who don't watch TV would likely be excluded from any potential study based on factor, like illiteracy or poverty level, that mark them as distinct from other participants.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: Many things such as sporting events [297], alcohol [298], and marriage [299] can lead to increased violence and aggression, however they are not condemned as inherently bad.
